unnormalised: **Data Plan Prices Remain Static Amidst Spectrum Auction Anticipation**
normalised: **Data Plan Prices Remain Static Amidst Spectrum Auction Anticipation**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Indian telecommunications providers are holding steady on their data plan pricing, market analysts note, as the industry awaits the upcoming 5G spectrum auction. While Reliance Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea have all introduced minor tweaks to bundled services, the core cost per GB remains largely unchanged.
normalised: New Delhi – Indian telecommunications providers are holding steady on their data plan pricing, market analysts note, as the industry awaits the upcoming five G spectrum auction. While Reliance Jio, Airtel, and Vodafone Idea have all introduced minor tweaks to bundled services, the core cost per G B remains largely unchanged.

unnormalised: “This stability likely reflects a wait-and-see approach,” commented Dr. Meena Sharma, professor of telecommunications at IIT Delhi. “Providers are conserving capital ahead of potentially significant investment in spectrum licenses.”
normalised: “This stability likely reflects a wait-and-see approach,” commented Doctor Meena Sharma, professor of telecommunications at I I T Delhi. “Providers are conserving capital ahead of potentially significant investment in spectrum licenses.”

unnormalised: Currently, the average data plan offers approximately 2GB of daily data for around Rs. 250-300, with validity periods ranging from 28 to 84 days. Some plans also incorporate over-the-top (OTT) content subscriptions, mirroring the trend popularized by services like Netflix and Amazon Prime.
normalised: Currently, the average data plan offers approximately two G B of daily data for around rupee two hundred and fifty to three hundred, with validity periods ranging from twenty eight to eighty four days. Some plans also incorporate over-the-top (O T T) content subscriptions, mirroring the trend popularized by services like Netflix and Amazon Prime.

unnormalised: Industry insiders suggest that post-auction, we might see differentiated data plans focusing on lower latency applications, tailored for use cases like telemedicine and industrial automation, echoing scenes of futuristic tech showcased in Bollywood films like "Robot." However, any substantial price changes are unlikely until late 2024.
normalised: Industry insiders suggest that post-auction, we might see differentiated data plans focusing on lower latency applications, tailored for use cases like telemedicine and industrial automation, echoing scenes of futuristic tech showcased in Bollywood films like "Robot." However, any substantial price changes are unlikely until late two thousand and twenty four.
